articles.title: Shrugging off crypto winter, Galaxy Digital’s Mike Novogratz calls inaugural NFT launch ‘building for the future’
articles.summary: Despite the ongoing "crypto winter" and declining NFT sales, Galaxy Digital CEO Mike Novogratz remains bullish on NFTs, launching the company's inaugural collection of 3,210 digital collectibles. The NFTs, created in partnership with Time's Web3 initiative TIMEPieces, will be airdropped for free to employees and partners, with Novogratz emphasizing it as "building for the future" and a way to foster community spirit rather than a financial endeavor. He points to corporate adoption of NFTs by companies like Nike and the NBA as evidence of their long-term viability.

articles.title: Strive launches Strive 500 ETF
articles.summary: Strive Asset Management has introduced its second index fund, the Strive 500 ETF (NYSE: STRV), designed to mirror the Solactive GBS United States 500 Index. The ETF aims to provide diversified large-cap exposure to US corporations and seeks to unlock investor value through pro-fiduciary shareholder engagement, moving companies to prioritize value maximization over other agendas. Strive emphasizes its commitment to clients' financial interests, independent of social or political objectives.

articles.title: OTT Platform DISNEY+ HOTSTAR now supports Dolby Atmos on compatible TVs, AVRs, soundbars, Android smartphones and iOS devices
articles.summary: Disney+ Hotstar has expanded its audio support to include Dolby Atmos for its users, delivering a multidimensional, spatial sound experience on compatible devices. This new feature, complementing existing Dolby Vision support, aims to immerse users more deeply in their favorite movies and shows. A wide range of titles, including Hotstar Specials and Multiplex content, are now available with Dolby Atmos.

articles.title: Company created by two South Africans tops S&P 500 30-year performance
articles.summary: Monster Beverage Corporation, co-founded by two South African WITS graduates, has ranked as the top-performing stock in the S&P 500 over the last 30 years, achieving a staggering 213,088% total return. The company, initially Hansen Natural Corporation, was acquired in 1990 by Rodney Sacks and Hilton Schlosberg and saw significant growth after launching Monster Energy in 2002. This success story highlights the remarkable financial performance of the energy drink giant, even outperforming tech titans like Amazon, Apple, and Nvidia.

articles.title: New iPhones have Qualcomm satellite modem, new Apple radio chips
articles.summary: Apple's new iPhone 14 models incorporate a Qualcomm X65 modem chip, which enables satellite connectivity for emergency messaging. While the Qualcomm chip provides the core satellite communication capability, Apple clarified that the iPhone 14 also contains proprietary custom-designed radio frequency components and software specifically developed by Apple for its Emergency SOS via satellite feature. This new feature allows users to send emergency messages when outside of WiFi or cellular service, utilizing Globalstar's satellite network capacity.

articles.title: First It Was Health Monitoring Devices on Wrists, Now It’s Health Monitoring on Fingers
articles.summary: The article discusses the emergence of smart rings for health monitoring, highlighting Movano, Inc.'s new Movano Ring and the existing Oura Ring. These devices offer miniaturized diagnostic capabilities, tracking various health metrics like heart rate, temperature, and sleep. Movano is seeking FDA clearance and aims to eventually add cuffless blood pressure and blood glucose monitoring.

articles.title: Graphjet Technology, the State-of-the-Art Graphene and Graphite Producer, Announces Membership Agreement with the MIT Industrial Liaison Program
articles.summary: Graphjet Technology Sdn. Bhd., a Malaysian graphene and graphite producer, has joined the Massachusetts Institute of Technology's Industrial Liaison Program (MIT ILP), becoming the first Malaysian company to do so. This membership will provide Graphjet with access to MIT's expertise, research, and educational opportunities, aiming to advance its technology development and strengthen its position in the industry. Through this collaboration, Graphjet seeks to connect with leading companies and talents to apply new technologies, particularly in areas like big data, automobiles, manufacturing, and healthcare.

articles.title: Peloton marketing, comms chief Dara Treseder joins Autodesk
articles.summary: Dara Treseder, formerly Peloton's SVP and global head of marketing, comms, and membership, has been appointed Chief Marketing Officer at Autodesk, effective October 14. She will be responsible for Autodesk's global marketing strategy, overseeing worldwide marketing, brand and communications, global demand generation, and education business teams. Treseder's appointment comes as Autodesk reported a 17% increase in revenue to $1.2 billion in Q2 of its 2023 fiscal year.

articles.title: Herbalife Nutrition Survey Reveals Top Ten Modern Day Entrepreneurs and What Traits are Needed to Join the List
articles.summary: A Herbalife Nutrition survey identified Bill Gates, Jeff Bezos, and Steve Jobs as the top three most influential modern entrepreneurs, followed by Elon Musk and Mark Zuckerberg. The study, involving 2,750 respondents across the U.S., Mexico, and Israel, also explored traits essential for entrepreneurial success, highlighting creativity and intelligence as most important. Herbalife Nutrition emphasized the ongoing strength of the entrepreneurial spirit and the company's commitment to fostering it.
